entry.title: Armenia issues $750M eurobond in bid to manage national debt: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia issues $750M eurobond in bid to manage national debt: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç A free trade deal between the Eurasian Economic Union and Iran will go into effect mid-May, a development observers say could significantly boost Armenia‚Äôs economy. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank left interest rates unchanged at 6.75%, citing increased global uncertainty and risks amid U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs escalating trade war. üìç Armenia issued a $750 million eurobond on the London Stock Exchange as it seeks to manage its growing national debt. The bond matures in 10 years with a 7.1% yield. üìç Officials defended Armenia‚Äôs new cryptocurrency regulations, even as firms decried the rules as too onerous and warned they could lead to the sector‚Äôs virtual elimination. üìç Interview with Central Bank Deputy Chair Armen Nurbekyan (in Armenian): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rK6L_8XlVHI üìç Interview with Bitcoin Armenia‚Äôs Eduard Avetisyan (in Armenian): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jK2UUIe7RMk

entry.title: Armenia denies troop movements on the border with Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Armenia denies troop movements on the border with Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry dismissed claims circulating on social media about a recent shooting incident on the border with Azerbaijan in the Gegharkunik region of southeastern Armenia. üìç Former Secretary General of NATO Anders Fogh Rasmussen urged the European Union to use its energy leverage to pressure Azerbaijan into signing a peace agreement with Armenia. üìç 70 Days Behind Enemy Lines ‚Äì Surviving War and Finding Purpose: https://youtu.be/GbJ3FrcO2N0?si=7TkxhvqE79W81aEq

entry.title: What Turkey wants in the South Caucasus

media:group.media:title: What Turkey wants in the South Caucasus
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Mustafa Aydin, a professor of international relations at Kadir Has University is in Yerevan to participate in a conference organized by the Caucasus Institute entitled ‚ÄúGathering Storm: Regional Security of the South Caucasus in the Context of the Crisis of the Global Order.‚Äù He speaks with CivilNet about Turkey‚Äôs evolving role amid global and regional upheavals, as well as the country‚Äôs positioning between the Russia-Ukraine war and conflicts in the Middle East. The discussion focuses on how Turkey views the South Caucasus and, in particular, normalization attempts with Armenia. Aydin emphasizes the importance of people-to-people contact between Turks and Armenians to debunk myths they hold about each other and increase mutual understanding.
0:00 Turkey‚Äôs role amid global conflicts 3:42 Turkey and Russia in the South Caucasus 7:13 Political views of the South Caucasus toward Russia 9:06 Why doesn‚Äôt Turkey open its border with Armenia? 12:13 Turkey‚Äôs deference to Azerbaijani issues 16:07 Turkey doesn‚Äôt prioritize relations with Armenia 23:13 Recent visit of Turkish journalists to Armenia 26:24 Armenian and Turkish views of each other
